item.title: Penelope add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "My dear, I don't give a damn." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Dear Scarlett! You aren't helpless. Anyone as selfish and determined as you are is never helpless. God help the Yankees if they should get you." -Rhett Butler" -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Sarcasm is the last refuge of the imaginatively bankrupt." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description:
"Sir,"she said,"you are no gentleman!"
An apt observation,"he answered airily."And, you, Miss, are no lady." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Hardships make or break people." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Until you've lost your reputation, you never realize what a burden it was or what freedom really is." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "That's what's wrong with you. All your beaux have respected you too much, though God knows why, or they have been too afraid of you to really do right by you. The result is that you are unendurably uppity. You should be kissed and by someone who knows how." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Philippa Gregory
item.description: "You can smile when your heart is breaking because you're a woman." -- Philippa Gregory

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Philippa Gregory
item.description: "Oh yes. Draw your hem back from my mud, little sister." -- Philippa Gregory

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Philippa Gregory
item.description: "The world hasn't changed that much; men still rule." -- Philippa Gregory

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I can bear pain myself, he said softly, but I couldna bear yours. That would take more strength than I have." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "Oh, aye, Sassenach. I am your master . . . and you're mine. Seems I canna possess your soul without losing my own." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "There are things that I canna tell you, at least not yet. And I'll ask nothing of ye that ye canna give me. But what I would ask of ye---when you do tell me something, let it be the truth. And I'll promise ye the same. We have nothing now between us, save---respect, perhaps. And I think that respect has maybe room for secrets, but not for lies. Do ye agree?" -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "For where all love is, the speaking is unnecessary. It is all. It is undying. And it is enough." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "There are no safe choices. Only other choices." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "How I'd love to get away from here and be someone else for a while in a place where no one knows or expects certain things from me." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "My cholera's acting up again." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Penelope add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Penelope add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Penelope add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Penelope add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The wide world is all about you: you can fence yourselves in, but you cannot for ever fence it out." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Penelope add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Farewell! I go to find the Sun!" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "I've always been very confident in my immaturity." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "My behavior is nonetheless, deplorable. Unfortunately, I'm quite prone to such bouts of deplorability--take for instance, my fondness for reading books at the dinner table." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Penelope add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Is this the part where you start tearing off strips of your shirt to bind my wounds?" "If you wanted me to rip my clothes off, you should have just asked." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Penelope add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Penelope add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Do you remember back at the hotel when you promised that if we lived, you’d get dressed up in a nurse’s outfit and give me a sponge bath?" asked Jace. "It was Simon who promised you the sponge bath." "As soon as I’m back on my feet, handsome," said Simon. "I knew we should have left you a rat." -- Cassandra Clare
